covered: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios (TC01-TC06, TC11, TC15, TC21) verify successful retrieval with default and explicit pagination parameters, empty results, and partial datasets.

Pagination: Scenarios cover offset/limit behavior, offset beyond dataset, default limit handling, limit boundaries, very large datasets for performance, and combinations of offset+limit+audit (TC02, TC05, TC07, TC11, TC16, TC17, TC18).

Query Parameters: Good coverage of valid and invalid query parameter combinations (audit FULL/MINIMAL/NONE, invalid audit, negative offset/limit, unexpected extra params) in TC01-TC05, TC08-TC10, TC14, TC15, TC16.
Empty Response: Scenario for no bundles ensures endpoint returns an empty array with 200 (TC06).
Error Handling: Negative and out-of-range parameter errors, invalid audit values, service unavailability, timeout, and SQL-injection style input are covered (TC08-TC10, TC11, TC13, TC14, TC16, TC22).
Audit Behavior: Differences between NONE, MINIMAL, and FULL are tested explicitly (TC01, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC19, TC20).
Performance/Load: Response time and concurrent-request performance checks are included (TC17, TC18).
Regression & Backward Compatibility: Explicit regression scenarios for audit behavior and no-audit param compatibility are present (TC19, TC20).
gaps: Caching Behavior: No scenarios check HTTP caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) or cache-related responses (304 Not Modified).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for rate limiting (429 responses) or behavior under burst request patterns beyond concurrent-success performance tests.
Schema / Content-Type Validation: Tests do not assert response Content-Type headers or validate the full Bundle object schema (field presence, types, nested structures) against definitions.
Authorization Variants: Only authentication-missing/invalid (401) is present — there is no test for authorized-but-forbidden (403) or role-scope related access controls if applicable.
Pagination Consistency: No tests for stable ordering across pages (deterministic sort/ordering, duplicates across pages), or for changes during pagination (concurrent modifications while paginating).

Boundary Values for limit: While very large and negative values are tested, there is no explicit test for the documented default (limit=100) being enforced when client passes limit=0 or omitted, nor tests for limit=1 or limit equal to default limit to exercise boundaries precisely.
Error Response Structure: When errors are returned (400/422/503/504), tests check presence of an error message but do not validate error codes/details schema or correlation IDs for troubleshooting.
recommendations: Add caching tests: verify Cache-Control and ETag headers, behavior with conditional GET (If-None-Match) and 304 responses.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate burst requests to assert 429 responses or throttling headers and recovery behavior.
Add schema validation tests: assert Content-Type and validate Bundle object structure and types against the API definition for multiple bundles and audit levels.
Add ordering and pagination consistency tests: verify deterministic ordering across pages, no duplicates/missing items when paginating, and behavior when data changes between page fetches.
Add boundary tests for limit=0, limit=1, limit=100 (default) and limit exactly at max allowed to confirm exact enforcement of defaults and maxima.
Add authorization-variant tests: cover forbidden scenarios (403) and role/permission combinations if the API supports scoped access.
Enhance error-structure checks: validate error payload schema, presence of error codes, and correlation/request-id headers for easier debugging.
Consider rate and caching-related regression tests in CI to detect performance/caching regressions early.
